SystemSettings.description:
Object Types are:
  * apic_connectivity_preference
  * bgp
  * bgp_route_reflectors
  * coop_group
  * endpoint_controls
  * fabric_wide_settings
  * global_aes_encryption_settings
  * isis_policy
  * port_tracking
  * ptp_and_latency_measurement
  * recommended_settings

coop_group.description:
Required Attribute is:
  * type

 Optional Attribute is:
  * annotation
  * description

endpoint_controls.description:
Attributes are:
  * annotation
  * ep_loop_protection
  * ip_aging
  * rouge_ep_control

fabric_wide_settings.description:
Optional Attribute are:
  * annotation
  * disable_remote_ep_learning
  * enforce_domain_validation
  * enforce_epg_vlan_validation
  * enforce_subnet_check
  * leaf_opflex_client_authentication
  * leaf_ssl_opflex
  * reallocate_gipo
  * restrict_infra_vlan_traffic
  * ssl_opflex_versions
  * spine_opflex_client_authentication
  * spine_ssl_opflex

global_aes_encryption_settings.description:
Optional Attribute are:
  * annotation
  * clear_passphrase
  * description
  * enable_encryption
  * passphrase_key_derivation_version

isis_policy.description:
Optional Attribute are:
  * annotation
  * isis_mtu
  * isis_metric_for_redistributed_routes
  * lsp_fast_flood_mode
  * lsp_generation_initial_wait_interval
  * lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval
  * lsp_generation_second_wait_interval
  * sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_interval
  * sfp_computation_frequency_maximum_wait_interval
  * sfp_computation_frequency_second_wait_interval

port_tracking.description:
Optional Attribute are:
  * annotation
  * delay_restore_timer
  * include_apic_ports
  * number_of_active_ports
  * port_tracking_state

ptp_and_latency_measurement.description:
Optional Attribute are:
  * annotation
  * announce_interval
  * announce_timeout
  * delay_request_interval
  * global_domain
  * global_priority_1
  * global_priority_2
  * precision_time_protocol
  * ptp_profile
  * sync_interval

recommended_settings.description:
Use This to Configure the Recommended Settings for the Following Policy Types:
  * coop_group
  * endpoint_controls
  * fabric_wide_settings
  * global_aes_encryption_settings
  * isis_policy
  * port_tracking
  * ptp_and_latency_measurement

SystemSettings.title: System => System Settings

interface_to_use_for_external_connection.description:
The preferred management connectivity preference. Options are:
  * inband — Executes in-band management connectivity between the APIC server to external devices through leaf switches on the ACI fabric.
  * ooband: (default) — Executes out-of-band management connectivity between the APIC server to external devices through connections external to the ACI fabric.
interface_to_use_for_external_connection.title: interface_to_use_for_external_connections

SystemSettings:BgpRouteReflector.description:
pods - Required Attributes are:
  * pod_id
  * route_reflector_nodes

pods.description:
pods - Required Attributes are:
  * pod_id
  * route_reflector_nodes

route_reflector_nodes.description: List of BGP Route Reflector Nodes.
route_reflector_nodes.title: route_reflector_nodes

pods.title: pods

SystemSettings:BgpRouteReflector.title: bgp_route_reflectors - Pod(s) BGP Route Reflectors.

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

type.description:
COOP protocol is enhanced to support two ZMQ authentication modes:
  * compatible — Type COOP accepts both MD5 authenticated and non-authenticated ZMQ connections for message transportation.
  * strict: (defualt) — COOP allows MD5 authenticated ZMQ connections only.
Note: The APIC provides a managed object (fabric:SecurityToken), that includes an attribute to be used for the MD5 password. An attribute in this managed object, called 'token', is a string that changes every hour. COOP obtains the notification from the DME to update the password for ZMQ authentication. The attribute token value is not displayed.
type.title: type

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

ep_loop_protection.description:
Attributes are:
  * action
  * administrative_state
  * loop_detection_interval
  * loop_detection_multiplier

rouge_ep_control.description:
Attributes are:
  * administrative_state
  * hold_interval
  * rouge_interval
  * rouge_multiplier

action.description:
Attributes are:
  * bd_learn_disablebd_learn_disable
  * port_disable
Action to Perform when a Loop is dected.

bd_learn_disable.description: Disable bridge domain learning when a loop is detected.
bd_learn_disable.title: bd_learn_disable

port_disable.description: Disable the Port when a loop is detected.
port_disable.title: port_disable

action.title: action

administrative_state.description:
The administrative state of the endpoint loop protection policy, options are:
  * disabled
  * enabled
administrative_state.title: administrative_state

loop_detection_interval.description: Sets the loop detection interval, which specifies the time to detect a loop. The interval range is from 30 to 300 seconds.
loop_detection_interval.title: loop_detection_interval

loop_detection_multiplier.description: Sets the loop detection multiplication factor, which is the number of times a single EP moves between ports within the loop detection interval.
loop_detection_multiplier.title: loop_detection_multiplier

SystemSettings:EndpointControls:EpLoopPr.title: ep_loop_protection - Endpoint Controls => EP Loop Protection.

administrative_state.description:
Enables and disables the IP aging policy, options are:
  * disabled
  * enabled
administrative_state.title: administrative_state

administrative_state.description:
The administrative state of the Rogue EP Control policy, options are:
  * disabled
  * enabled
administrative_state.title: administrative_state

hold_interval.description: Interval in seconds after the endpoint is declared rogue, where it is kept static so learning is prevented and the traffic to and from the rogue endpoint is dropped. After this interval, the endpoint is deleted. Valid values are from 300 to 3600.Interval in seconds after the endpoint is declared rogue, where it is kept static so learning is prevented and the traffic to and from the rogue endpoint is dropped. After this interval, the endpoint is deleted. Valid values are from 300 to 3600.
hold_interval.title: hold_interval

rouge_interval.description: Sets the Rogue EP detection interval, which specifies the time to detect rogue endpoints. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 seconds.
rouge_interval.title: rouge_interval

rouge_multiplier.description: Sets the Rogue EP Detection multiplication factor for determining if an endpoint is unauthorized. If the endpoint moves more times than this number, within the EP detection interval, the endpoint is declared rogue. Valid values are from 2 to 10.
rouge_multiplier.title: rouge_multiplier

SystemSettings:EndpointControls:RougeEpC.title: rouge_ep_control - Endpoint Controls => Rouge EP Control.

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

disable_remote_ep_learning.description:
You should enable this policy in fabrics which include the Cisco Nexus 9000 series switches, 93128TX, 9396PX, or 9396TX switches with the N9K-M12PQ uplink module, after all the nodes have been successfully upgraded to APIC Release 2.2(2x).
  * Note: After any of the following configuration changes, you may need to manually flush previously learned IP endpoints:
    - Remote IP endpoint learning is disabled.
    - The VRF is configured for ingress policy enforcement.
    - At least one Layer 3 interface exists in the VRF.
  * To manually flush previously learned IP endpoints, enter the following command on both VPC peers: vsh -c 'clear system internal epm endpoint vrf <vrf-name> remote'
disable_remote_ep_learning.title: disable_remote_ep_learning

enforce_domain_validation.description: Enable a validation check when static paths are added, to ensure that a domain is attached to the EPG on the path.
enforce_domain_validation.title: enforce_domain_validation

enforce_epg_vlan_validation.description:
When checked, the system globally prevents overlapping VLAN pools from being assigned to EPGs.
  * Note:  If overlapping VLAN pools already exist and this parameter is checked, the system returns an error. You must assign VLAN pools that are not overlapping to the EPGs before choosing this feature.
  * If this parameter is checked and an attempt is made to add an overlapping VLAN pool to an EPG, the system returns an error.
enforce_epg_vlan_validation.title: enforce_epg_vlan_validation

enforce_subnet_check.description: When checked, IP address learning on outside of subnets configured in a VRF, for all VRFs are disabled.
enforce_subnet_check.title: enforce_subnet_check

leaf_opflex_client_authentication.description: To enforce Opflex client certificate authentication on leaf switches for GOLF and Linux.
leaf_opflex_client_authentication.title: leaf_opflex_client_authentication

leaf_ssl_opflex.description: To enable SSL Opflex transport for leaf switches.
leaf_ssl_opflex.title: leaf_ssl_opflex

reallocate_gipo.description: Enable reallocating group IP outer addresses (Gipos) on non-stretched BDs to make room for stretched BDs.
reallocate_gipo.title: reallocate_gipo

restrict_infra_vlan_traffic.description: This feature restricts Infra VLAN traffic to only network paths specified by Infra security entry policies. When this feature is enabled, each leaf switch limits Infra VLAN traffic between compute nodes to allow only iVXLAN traffic. The switch also limits traffic to fabric nodes to allow only OpFlex and iVXLAN/VXLAN traffic. APIC management traffic is allowed on front panel ports on the Infra VLAN.
restrict_infra_vlan_traffic.title: restrict_infra_vlan_traffic

spine_opflex_client_authentication.description: To enforce Opflex client certificate authentication on spine switches for GOLF and Linux.
spine_opflex_client_authentication.title: spine_opflex_client_authentication

spine_ssl_opflex.description: To enable SSL Opflex transport for spine switches..
spine_ssl_opflex.title: spine_ssl_opflex

ssl_opflex_versions.description:
Attributes are:
  * TLSv1
  * TLSv1_1
  * TLSv1_2
This is only applicable to APIC version 5.2 and greater.
ssl_opflex_versions.title: ssl_opflex_versions - SSL Opflex Versions.

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

clear_passphrase.description: Flag to clear the passphrase when disabling Global AES Encryption.
clear_passphrase.title: clear_passphrase

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

enable_encryption.description: Enables strong encryption on the import or export policy.
enable_encryption.title: enable_encryption

passphrase_key_derivation_version.description:
v1 is the only option today. Options are:
  * v1
passphrase_key_derivation_version.title: passphrase_key_derivation_version

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

isis_mtu.description: The IS-IS Domain policy LSP MTU. The MTU is from 128 to 4352.
isis_mtu.title: isis_mtu

isis_metric_for_redistributed_routes.description: The IS-IS metric that is used for all imported routes into IS-IS. The values available are from 1 to 63.
isis_metric_for_redistributed_routes.title: isis_metric_for_redistributed_routes

lsp_fast_flood_mode.description:
The IS-IS Fast-Flooding of LSPs improves Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System (IS-IS) convergence time when new link-state packets (LSPs) are generated in the network and shortest path first (SPF) is triggered by the new LSPs. The mode can be:
  * disabled
  * enabled
lsp_fast_flood_mode.title: lsp_fast_flood_mode

lsp_generation_initial_wait_interval.description: The LSP generation initial wait interval. This is used in the LSP generation interval for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
lsp_generation_initial_wait_interval.title: lsp_generation_initial_wait_interval

lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval.description: The LSP generation maximum wait interval. This is used in the LSP generation interval for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval.title: lsp_generation_maximum_wait_interval

lsp_generation_second_wait_interval.description: The LSP generation second wait interval. This is used in the LSP generation interval for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
lsp_generation_second_wait_interval.title: lsp_generation_second_wait_interval

sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_i.description: The SPF computation frequency initial wait interval. This is used in the SPF computations for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_i.title: sfp_computation_frequency_initial_wait_interval

sfp_computation_frequency_maximum_wait_i.description: The SPF computation frequency maximum wait interval. This is used in the SPF computations for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
sfp_computation_frequency_maximum_wait_i.title: sfp_computation_frequency_maximum_wait_interval

sfp_computation_frequency_second_wait_in.description: The SPF computation frequency second wait interval. This is used in the SPF computations for the LSP MTU.  Permitted Values are 50 to 120000.
sfp_computation_frequency_second_wait_in.title: sfp_computation_frequency_second_wait_interval

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

delay_restore_timer.description: The timer that controls the delay restore interval time in seconds. The range is from 1 second to 300 seconds.
delay_restore_timer.title: delay_restore_timer

include_apic_ports.description: If you put a check in the box, port tracking brings down the Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) ports when the leaf switch loses connectivity to all fabric ports (that is, there are 0 fabric links). Enable this feature only if the Cisco APICs are dual- or multi-homed to the fabric. Bringing down the Cisco APIC ports helps in switching over to the secondary link in the case of a dual-homed Cisco APIC.
include_apic_ports.title: include_apic_ports

number_of_active_ports.description: Number of active spine links that triggers port tracking. The range is from 0 to 12.
number_of_active_ports.title: number_of_active_ports

port_tracking_state.description:
The administrative port tracking state. The state can be:
  * off
  * on
port_tracking_state.title: port_tracking_state

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

announce_interval.description:
Specifies the logarithm of the mean interval in seconds with base 2 for a master port to send announce messages. The range depends on the chosen profile:
  * AES67-2015: 0 to 4. These values result in a range of 1 to 16 seconds.
  * Default: 0 to 4. These values result in a range of 1 to 16 seconds.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: -3 to 1. These values result in a range of 0.125 to 2 seconds.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
announce_interval.title: announce_interval

announce_timeout.description:
Specifies the number of announce messages that the system waits before the PTP announce message is considered expired. The range and the default depend on the chosen PTP profile:
  * AES67-2015: 2 to 10.
  * Default: 2 to 10.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: 2 to 10.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
announce_timeout.title: announce_timeout

delay_request_interval.description:
Specifies the logarithm of the mean interval in seconds with base 2 for a slave port to send delay request messages. The range depends on the chosen PTP profile:
  * AES67-2015: -3 to 5. These values result in a range of 0.125 to 32 seconds.
  * Default: 0 to 5. These values result in a range of 0.5 to 2 seconds.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: 0 to 5. These values result in a range of 0.5 to 2 seconds.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
delay_request_interval.title: delay_request_interval

global_domain.description: Specifies the PTP domain number. Although multiple PTP domains are not supported in Cisco ACI, you can still change the domain number used in Cisco ACI. The same value is used on all leaf and spine nodes.  The valid range of values is 0 to 128. The default is 0.
global_domain.title: global_domain

global_priority_1.description: Specifies a value that is used to decide the grandmaster clock. The same value is used on all leaf and spine nodes. The ftag0 root spine switch uses the configured value, minus 1.  The valid range of values is 1 to 255. The default is 255 so that the root spine of ftag0 tree can be the grandmaster in case there is no external node that can serve as the grandmaster.
global_priority_1.title: global_priority_1

global_priority_2.description: Specifies a value that is used to decide the grandmaster clock. The same value is used on all leaf and spine nodes. The ftag0 root spine switch uses the configured value, minus 1.  The valid range of values is 1 to 255. The default is 255 so that the root spine of ftag0 tree can be the grandmaster in case there is no external node that can serve as the grandmaster.
global_priority_2.title: global_priority_2

precision_time_protocol.description:
Specifies the protocol administrative state. The state can be:
  * disabled — PTP is disabled on all leaf and spine nodes.
  * enabled: (default) — PTP is enabled on all fabric links that belong to the ftag tree with ID 0 (ftag0 tree), which is one of the internal tree topologies that is automatically built based on Cisco ACI infra ISIS for loop free connectivity between all leaf and spine nodes in each pod.
precision_time_protocol.title: precision_time_protocol

ptp_profile.description:
Specifies the PTP profile, which defines the range and default value of various PTP parameters, such as intervals. The values are:
  * AES67-2015: (default) — AES67-2015, which is the standard for audio over Ethernet and audio over IP interoperability.
  * Default — IEEE 1588-2008, which is the default PTP profile for clock synchronization.
  * SMPTE-2059-2 — SMTPE ST2059-2015, which is the standard for video over IP.
The profile is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
ptp_profile.title: ptp_profile

sync_interval.description:
Specifies the logarithm of the mean interval in seconds with base 2 for a master port to send synchronization messages. The range and the default depend on the chosen PTP profile:
  * AES67-2015: -4 to 1. These values result in a range of 0.0625 to 16 seconds.
  * Default: -1 to 1. These values result in a range of 0.5 to 2 seconds.
  * SMPTE-2059-2: -4 to -1. These values result in a range of 0.0625 to 0.5 seconds. SMPTE defines this as -7 to -1. However, Cisco ACI allows only -4 to -1 for hardware and software stability.
The value is applied to all PTP-enabled fabric links.
sync_interval.title: sync_interval

coop_group.description: Apply the recommended settings for the COOP Group in System Settings.  See defaults/system_settings.yaml to view these settings.
coop_group.title: coop_group

endpoint_controls.description:
endpoint_controls - Attributes are:

ep_loop_protection.description: Apply the recommended settings for the EP Loop Protection in Endpoint Controls in System Settings.  See defaults/system_settings.yaml to view these settings.

rouge_ep_control.description: Apply the recommended settings for the Rouge EP Control in Endpoint Controls in System Settings.  See defaults/system_settings.yaml to view these settings.
rouge_ep_control.title: rouge_ep_control

endpoint_controls.title: endpoint_controls - Endpoint Controls

global_aes_encryption_settings.description: Apply the recommended settings for the Global AES Encryption Settngs, in System Settings.  See defaults/system_settings.yaml to view these settings.
global_aes_encryption_settings.title: global_aes_encryption_settings

isis_policy.description: Apply the recommended settings for the ISIS Policy in System Settings.  See defaults/system_settings.yaml to view these settings.
